definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Producers therefore bargained with her agent for a lower appearance fee.
sentences.chinese: 演出商紛紛開始砍價，降低天后出場費。

sentences.english: It didn’t matter that the audience was small; it didn’t matter that the admission was only $5.
sentences.chinese: 無論觀衆羣是大是小，也不管這出場費只有5美元。

definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: to dress up and make up (like an actor)
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
